Requirements

Strong understanding of UX and responsive design principles

Compensation

$50 per job

title: Front End App Developer for Wordpress Plugin
description:
Role Overview

As a Frontend Developer, you will focus on the user-facing side of our WordPress plugin. You‚Äôll work with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to deliver clean, responsive, and intuitive interfaces. While the plugin contains PHP (as all WordPress plugins do), no prior PHP experience is required ‚Äî you‚Äôll primarily work on the frontend layer, integrating your code into our GitHub-managed repository.

This is an excellent role for someone eager to work in the WordPress ecosystem, learn plugin development workflows, and contribute to a fast-moving product.

Responsibilities

Develop and maintain the frontend of the JobCapturePro WordPress plugin.

Write clean, scalable, and well-documented HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Collaborate with backend developers on integration points.

Work from a GitHub repository (branching, pull requests, code reviews).

Implement responsive, accessible UI components.

Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize frontend performance.

Stay current on frontend best practices and WordPress standards.

Requirements

Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript.

Experience building responsive layouts and working with cross-browser compatibility.

Familiarity with version control (Git/GitHub).

Willingness to learn WordPress plugin development basics.

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Ability to work independently and communicate effectively in a remote environment.

Nice to Have (but not required)

Familiarity with WordPress (themes, plugins, admin UI).

Experience with task runners/build tools (Webpack, Gulp, etc.).

Knowledge of accessibility best practices (WCAG).

Interest in UX/UI design.

What We Offer

Flexible, remote-first role.

Opportunity to grow into deeper WordPress/plugin development.

Collaborative, entrepreneurial environment.

The chance to make a direct impact on a growing SaaS-style product.

description:
Faith-Sensitive Closer (Commission-Based, Remote)**

**Compensation:** Commission-based (15‚Äì20% per sale)
**Commitment:** Ongoing, flexible schedule
**Location:** Remote

---

## **About Us**

We are **Simple Systems Consulting**, a church consulting and growth company helping pastors implement proven systems for healthy ministry. Our programs ‚Äî **Church Systems in a Box** and **Church Systems Bootcamp** ‚Äî equip leaders to grow without burning out or compromising their values.

We‚Äôre expanding our team with **faith-sensitive closers** who can help us connect with pastors, listen to their challenges, and guide them into the right growth program. This role is not about high-pressure selling. It‚Äôs about **coaching, listening, and partnering with church leaders** in a way that honors their calling and moves them toward action.

## **Your Role**

---

## **You Are a Fit If‚Ä¶**

* You have sales or closing experience (phone, Zoom, or in-person).
* You are comfortable speaking with pastors and church leaders.
* You can **blend spiritual sensitivity with confident sales skills**.
* You‚Äôre coachable and willing to use our playbook and systems.
* You‚Äôre reliable, professional, and outcome-driven.

---

## **Why Join Us?**

* All **warm leads** (no cold outreach).
* Clear playbook and funnels already in place.
* Work with a mission-driven team serving pastors across the U.S.
* Unlimited earning potential based on performance.

---

üëâ **How to Apply**
Send a short intro sharing:

1. Your experience in closing sales (esp. high-ticket).

title: WordPress/Elementor Developer Needed for Template Cleanup and Layout Design
description:
I need an experienced WordPress/Elementor Pro developer to help me clean up my existing Elementor template setup, build standardized templates across the site, and guide me through migrating old content into the correct WordPress structure ‚Äî without breaking SEO.

Scope of Work
1. Template Audit & Cleanup
-Review Elementor Theme Builder (Single Post, Pages, Archives, etc.).
-Identify/remove conflicting display conditions (e.g., multiple templates assigned to ‚ÄúBlog‚Äù).
-Standardize and simplify so there‚Äôs one master Blog template that applies consistently to all posts.
-Ensure the solution is SEO-safe: Yoast metadata, schema, H1/H2 hierarchy, and existing rankings must remain intact.

2. Standardized Templates
-Create flexible, reusable Elementor templates for:
Blog (Single Post template)
Solutions pages
Industry pages
Customer Stories / Case Studies
News / Press posts

Templates should:
-Maintain consistent design and branding.
-Follow SEO best practices (heading hierarchy, alt text, schema).
-Be easy for non-technical users to update.

3. Migration Support
-Show me how to migrate old content that was built as Elementor ‚ÄúSections‚Äù into real WordPress posts/pages using the new templates.
-Provide a step-by-step process so I can handle the migration myself.
-Ensure no loss of SEO during the transition (slugs/URLs, metadata, internal links remain intact).

4. Documentation & Training
-Deliver a short workflow guide for creating new Blog posts, Solutions, Industries, Customer Stories, and News items with the standardized templates.
-Include best practices for maintaining SEO when adding content.

Deliverables
-Clean, SEO-safe Standardized Elementor templates for Solutions, Industries, Customer Stories, and News.
-Documentation + training on migrating old content and creating new posts/pages.
-SEO integrity preserved (titles, metadata, schema, permalinks).

Requirements

-Expert-level Elementor Pro + Theme Builder experience.
-Strong WordPress content architecture knowledge (Posts vs Pages, dynamic templates).
-Proven ability to clean up templates without breaking SEO.
-Familiarity with Yoast SEO Premium, schema, and structured data.
-Ability to provide simple, non-technical training and documentation.

Nice to Have:
Experience with Elementor Flexbox Containers & Grid.
Background in SEO for B2B/enterprise websites.
